Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw two plants: one with plenty of water and light, depicted with vibrant green leaves and a tall, healthy stature.
The student can skillfully illustrate the second plant with little or no water and light, showing wilted leaves, a drooping posture, and a noticeably smaller size.
The student can effectively include symbols for water, such as raindrop icons and a watering can, near the well-nourished plant.
The student can accurately portray the need for light by drawing sun icons or rays of light shining on the healthy plant.
The student can creatively use patterns within the drawing, such as consistent green coloring or arrows, to convey that plants require both water and light to thrive.
The student can differentiate between conditions by ensuring that the healthier plant is distinctly more vibrant and larger compared to the unhealthy one.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally omit minor details, such as forgetting to label every symbol (e.g., not labeling all raindrop icons as 'water'), but these do not impede the overall understanding.

While the student has a thorough grasp of the core concepts, there may be slight inconsistencies in artistic execution, such as one or two leaves appearing green on the unhealthy plant due to natural variation.
